summary: This is an email chain from August 11, 2019, forwarding a report from an Associate Warden at MCC New York regarding a visit with inmate Jeffrey Epstein on Thursday, August 8, 2019. The report describes Epstein's condition, requests, and planned legal meetings, noting he denied suicidal thoughts and showed no signs of distress.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the email; an inmate at MCC New York's Special Housing Unit (SHU) who was visited by the Associate Warden, made various requests, and planned to meet with his attorneys.

persons.name: Associate Warden MCC New York
persons.context: The author of the forwarded report who visited inmate Jeffrey Epstein in the SHU on Thursday, August 8, 2019, and documented his condition, interactions, and requests.

connections.description: The Associate Warden visited and assessed inmate Epstein in the Special Housing Unit, documenting his mental state and requests.
Epstein was planning to meet with his attorneys to work on his legal situation, as noted in the report.
Epstein had a cell mate in the SHU with whom the Associate Warden observed him interacting.

events.title: Associate Warden's visit to Epstein in SHU
events.description: An Associate Warden visited inmate Jeffrey Epstein in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York. Epstein was getting ready to meet with his attorneys, made various requests (e.g., move to general population, social calls without speaker phone, retrieve a book), and denied any suicidal thoughts or mental health concerns.

events.title: Email forwarding visit report
events.description: An email was sent forwarding a report from the Associate Warden regarding the last contact with Jeffrey Epstein prior to her departure on Thursday, August 8, 2019.

locations: MCC New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York
Suicide watch area at MCC New York
keyFacts: On Thursday, August 8, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was visited by an Associate Warden in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York and was observed interacting with a cell mate.
Epstein denied any suicidal thoughts, intentions, or mental health concerns during the visit and showed no signs of distress, depression, or anxiety.
Epstein made specific requests to the Associate Warden, including moving to general population, social calls without a speaker phone, and retrieving a book left in the suicide watch area.
Epstein planned to meet with his attorneys on that day to work on his legal situation.
